III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/13/2023, youth was slammed to the ground during a restraint
resulting in a mark below the left knee.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
initially refused to be interviewed, then decided she would
however she would not allow MDHHS worker to ask her any
questions. Youth A was on nest which is where the youth camp
overnight and do activities. Youth A went out of boundaries which
she described as walking out of the barn without permission.
Youth A reported she was upset due to Staff 2 pushing her. Youth
A reported Staff 2 pushed her because Youth A was joking around
with another peer. Youth A would not provide much information
about the incident however reported she was restrained by Staff 4
at which time she received a sprained shoulder. Youth A
described the restraint as being placed in an Aegis Level 1 and
then transitioned into a Benevolent restraint by Staff 4. Youth A
reported her shoulder made a pop sound when placed in the
Benevolent restraint. Youth A reported she was forced to the
ground. Youth A could not explain how she was forced to the
ground. Youth A was in a seated restraint and was crying due to
her shoulder hurting. Youth A went to the emergency room and
the doctor stated her shoulder was sprained and she has a cyst
on her shoulder. Youth A was not aware of the cyst until it was
discovered in the Xray. Youth A reported she was not slammed to
the ground during this restraint. Youth A did not report any other
injuries. Youth A reported a separate restraint approximately two
weeks prior. Youth A was outside Sherk house where she was
restrained by Staff 6 and Staff 7. Youth A reported she was lifted
off the ground by Staff 7 and slammed to the ground. Youth A
reported she had gone out of bounds and Staff 6 and Staff 7 were
trying to get her to talk to them prior to returning into the house.
Youth A reported Staff 7 lifted her up and dropped her to the
ground and placed his knee in her back. Youth A did not report
any further information about the restraint. Youth A reported once
2

when she showered, a youth look over into her shower stall. A
staff witnessed this and told the youth that looked into Youth A’s
shower stall to stop. Youth A reported it has not happened again.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face via Teams on 3/30/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported Youth A
was trying to dance on her while they were at nest. Staff 1 told
Youth A that she could not do that. Youth A got mad and walked
out of the barn. Youth B reported Staff 1 did not push Youth A.
Youth B reported Youth A returned later in the night from being at
the emergency room and was in a sling for her shoulder. Youth B
was not aware of a restraint involving Youth A in February outside
the Ashmun-Sherk house.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported
the youth from Ashmun and Sherk house were at the barn as the
two groups of youth were on nest. Nest is an overnight stay at the
cabin. The youth were all in the barn and getting ready to head
back to the cabin. Youth A attempted to give Youth B a lap
dance. Staff 1 addressed Youth A about her boundaries. Youth A
began yelling at Staff 1 stating Staff 1 can’t tell her what to do as
Youth A is in Sherk House and Staff 1 is an Ashmun staff. Youth A
stormed off leaving the barn. Staff 2 and Staff 3 followed Youth A
as Staff 1 stayed behind with the other youth due to Staff 1 being
the trigger for Youth A. Staff 1 was not aware of what happened
after Youth A stormed off. Staff 1 was with Youth A after she
returned from the emergency room. Staff 1 reported Youth A
seemed “fine.” Youth A did have an arm sling on. Youth A made
statements that she was hurt during the restraint however did not
say how. Youth A made statements she was going to get staff in
trouble and wanted to talk to the on-call worker. Youth A did
speak to the on-call worker which was Staff 8.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face via Teams on 3/30/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. The youth were at nest.
Youth A gave a peer a lap dance and Staff 1 addressed this with
Youth A. Staff 1 stepped in between Youth A and Youth B and
put her hand between the youth, not touching either youth, and
redirected the behavior. Youth A became upset and left the barn
without permission (going out of bounds). Staff 2 and Staff 3
followed Youth A and used proximity control by getting in front of
Youth A to slow her down from walking. Staff 4 was on the radio
with Staff 2 and Staff 3 advising that she and Staff 5 were coming
to assist. Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 talked with Youth A
around the fire pit area. Staff 5 was doing most of the talking due
3

to her having the best rapport with Youth A. Youth A became
escalated again and got up and began walking again. Staff 2,
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were using proximity control by placing
themselves around Youth A. Youth A was pulling her hand back
at Staff 2 acting as she was going to hit her. Staff 4 told Youth A
to watch her hands a few times. Youth A continued to pull her
arm back as to hit Staff 2. Staff 4 and Staff 5 placed Youth A in a
level 2 Aegis restraint. Youth A was resisting the restraint and
moving her body and dropping her weight. Youth A was yelling
and screaming. Staff 5 took over the restraint by placing Youth A
in an Aegis safety. Youth A began yelling “ow, my arm”. Staff 4
asked Youth A what hurt so she could reposition/ adjust in the
restraint. Youth A would not answer. Staff 2 touched Youth A’s
shoulder and then other shoulder and Youth A did not indicate her
shoulders were hurt. Youth A continued crying and screaming.
Staff 4 showed staff that she was barely holding Youth A and then
released Youth A. Youth A was taken to the emergency room and
came back in a sling. Staff 2 reported she did not hear any
popping noises during the restraint. Youth A was not slammed to
the ground nor did Staff 4 and Youth A slip on ice. Staff 2 did not
have any concerns with the restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 saw
Youth A walking out of the barn dysregulated. Staff 2 and Staff 3
went to follow Youth A. Youth A was saying she was going to
walk back to Sherk House. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were using
proximity control to get in front of Youth A to stop her from walking
down the path. Staff 4 and Staff 5 arrived. Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4,
and Staff 5 began using proximity control by making a diamond
shape around Youth A. Youth A began pushing and shoving staff.
Staff 4 placed Youth A in a Benevolent restraint and transitioned
into an Aegis safety seated restraint. The path was slippery
however Staff 3 did not recall anyone slipping on ice. Staff 3
reported no one fell on ice and that Staff 4 transitioned the
restraint to the ground as taught per the Aegis restraint training
model. Youth A began crying. Staff 4 asked Youth A if anything
hurt and Youth A did not respond. Youth A continued crying and
not responding to staff. Staff 4 released Youth A from the restraint
as Youth A was not resisting and was sitting crying. Staff 5 took
Youth A to be examined by Nurse. Youth A refused to be
examined. Staff 3 transported Youth A to the emergency room to
be examined. Youth A was complaining of shoulder pain. Youth
A’s Xray showed a cyst on her shoulder. Staff 3 reported the
doctor did not feel Youth A needed a sling and that the cyst was
probably the cause of the pain. Staff 3 reported Youth A was
4

restrained due to her pushing staff. Staff 3 did not recall Youth A
trying or hitting any staff. Staff 3 reported once Youth A was
restrained, Youth A did not resist much during the restraint. Staff
3 did not have concerns with how the restraint was performed.
Youth A did not wear the sling again after the night of the restraint.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4
reported youth from Sherk and Ashmun House were on nest.
Sherk House youth were not following expectations as they did
not have their normal staff working. Staff 4 heard Youth A and
Staff 1 talking, and Staff 1 tell Youth A “I am your staff.” Youth B
stated “that bitch tried giving me a lap dance” referring to Youth A.
Youth A was back talking Staff 1. Staff 4 reported the youth were
getting chaotic in the barn, so she was focused on getting the
youth back to the cabin. Youth A walked out of the barn and Staff
2 and Staff 3 followed her. Staff 4 made sure all the other youth
were back in the cabin and then followed up with Staff 2 and Staff
3. Staff 4 directed Staff 2 and Staff 3 to get in front of Youth A on
the trail and use proximity control as Staff 4 was concerned with
how icy the trail was. Staff 4 drove over to where Youth A was
with Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 5 pulled up in another vehicle at the
same time to assist. Staff 4 got out of the car and immediately fell
due to the ice. Youth A was pushing Staff 2 and Staff 3 and they
were sliding on ice. Staff 4 and Staff 5 approached Youth A.
Youth A began yelling in Staff 4’s face about Staff 1 putting her
hands on Youth A. Staff 4 was asking Youth A about the
situation. Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were using proximity
control around Youth A as they were in a diamond shape to keep
Youth A from going further down the trail. Youth A was pushing
staff to try to get through. Youth A then sat on the bench near the
fire pit. Youth A reported Staff 1 pushed her. A staff corrected
Youth A as she was there, and Staff 1 did not push Youth A. Staff
4 did not recall which staff corrected Youth A. Youth A escalated
and got up from the bench and raised her arm/hand at Staff 4.
Staff 4 addressed Youth A to watch her hand. Youth A began
screaming again so close to Staff 4’s face that Youth A’s spit was
hitting Staff 4. Youth A raised her hand again to Staff 4 at which
time Staff 4 thought Youth A was going to slap her. Staff 4
grabbed Youth A’s hand and initiated a level 2 restraint. Staff 4
had Youth A’s right arm and Staff 5 secured Youth A’s left arm.
Youth A was fighting the restraint and Staff 4 and Staff 5 were
sliding all over on the ice. Staff 4 transitioned to a Benevolent
restraint and then to the Aegis safety which is a one person
seated restraint. Staff 4 reported she did not fall while
transitioning to the seated restraint. Staff 4 went into the Aegis
5

safety restraint due to her concerns that it was icy, and she felt it
was safer. Youth A was making threats during this time that she
was going to assault Staff 1. Staff 4 asked Youth A if anything
hurt in the restraint and Youth A began hysterically crying and
would not respond to Staff 4. Staff 4 released Youth A from the
restraint as Youth A had stopped struggling and was crying. After
Staff 4 released Youth A from the restraint Youth A continued to
sit on the ground crying. Staff 2 and Staff 5 assisted Youth A up.
Staff 5 took Youth A to medical to be examined. Staff 4 also went
to the building where medical is located to write the incident
report. Youth A was transported by Staff 3 to the emergency
room. Youth A came back from the emergency room with a sling
and the Xray showed she has a cyst on her shoulder. When
Youth A returned from the emergency room she was dancing and
did the “worm” dance in the sling. Staff 4 reported the only
concern she had with the restraint was when she asked Youth A if
anything hurt in the restraint is when Youth A began hysterically
crying.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 5
reported the youth were at nest and she responded to a call
stating a youth was out of bounds. Staff 5 drove to the location
and met Staff 4 at the location. It was icy, cold, and snowy
conditions. Youth A was near the bench and was upset as she
was pushing Staff 2. Youth A was yelling, cussing, and telling
staff that they cannot tell her what to do. Staff 4 and Staff 5
initiated a level 1 restraint and Staff 4 transitioned to a Benevolent
restraint, and then to an Aegis safety restraint. Youth A was
resisting the restraint. Staff 4 took over the restraint as it was icy,
and it was safer to be in the Aegis safety seated restraint. Staff 5
reported Staff 4 transitioned to the seated safety restraint and did
not fall. Once in the Aegis safety restraint, Youth A began crying
and would not respond to staff questions. Staff 4 asked Youth A if
anything hurt and Youth A did not respond. Staff 4 loosened the
restraint and then released as Youth A was not responding to
questions and continued to cry. Staff 5 took Youth A to Nurse to
be examined however Youth A was not responding to Nurse, so
Staff 3 took Youth A to the emergency room. Staff 5 reported she
had no concerns with the restraint Staff 4 preformed. Staff 5
reported Staff 4 never slammed Youth A down to the ground.
Youth A has not complained of arm/shoulder pain since that night.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 6 was on
call and was called to assist at Sherk as Youth A went out of
6

bounds. Youth A was sitting in the middle of Hainley field. Staff 6
reported it was cold, sleeting/hailing outside. Youth A refused to
go back to the house. Staff 5 came to assist Staff 6. Staff 5 and
Staff 6 sat with Youth A for approximately an hour and a half in the
field. After about an hour and a half, Youth A got up and said she
was cold. Youth A stated she was going to break into the house.
Staff 6 asked Youth A to talk about the expectations once back
inside the house. Youth A was refusing and Staff 5 and Staff 6
continued to wait outside with Youth A for another hour and a half.
Youth A went to the basement door and was banging on it. Youth
A was telling Staff 6 and Staff 7 to get away from her. Staff 6
asked Staff 7 to switch out with another staff that was in the house
to try a new staff to help the situation. Another staff came out and
Youth A began making threats to stab staff with a pen. Staff 7
switched out the new staff who went back into the house. Youth A
was banging on the window of the house. Youth A took the pen
out and Staff 7 asked Youth A to put the pen down. Youth A
refused. Staff 7 initiated a Benevolent restraint and transitioned to
an Aegis safety. Staff 6 reported it looked like Staff 7 slipped and
fell. Youth A fell on Staff 7. Staff 7 maintained the restraint and
then transitioned to a level 3 Aegis restraint. Staff 6 was able to
remove the pen from Youth A. Staff 7 then transitioned to a level
1 Aegis restraint and released Youth A. Staff 6 denied Staff 7
picking Youth A up and slamming her to the ground. Staff 6
reported Staff 7 and Youth A slipped on ice during the restraint.
Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 7
reported he was outside the Sherk house with Staff 6. Youth A
was kicking and hitting him at which time he initiated a Benevolent
hold. Staff 7 reported the ground was snowy and icy and he and
Youth A were on a patch of ice from the water freezing that
dripped off the roof. Staff 7 and Youth A fell however Staff 7
maintained Youth A in the Benevolent hold and transitioned to the
Aegis safety seated restraint. Staff 7 reported once he had
balance, he transitioned back to a standing Benevolent restraint.
Staff 7 reported he did not pick Youth A up and slam her to the
ground.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/22/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Nurse was working on
3/13/2023 and Youth A was brought to him following a restraint.
Youth A was crying and would not talk to him or allow him to
examine her. Nurse directed staff to take Youth A to the
emergency room to be examined. Nurse reported Youth A had an
Xray completed that showed a cyst on her shoulder that was
7

unrelated to the restraint. Youth A will be receiving follow up
treatment for the cyst. The emergency room provided Youth A
with a sling for her arm. Nurse has seen Youth A since 3/13/2023
and reports no concerns. Nurse reported Youth A has not been
wearing the sling she was provided from the emergency room.
The complainant is the facilities assigned licensing
consultant as consultant was made aware during an interview
with the youth.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Therapeutic Holds Procedures: When staff
have attempted to help the youth de-escalate without the
success of the youth returning to a safe and regulated state;
the use of a Therapeutic Hold may become necessary to
keep the youth safe. The only approved therapeutic hold
techniques are the methods and techniques taught in the
required Aegis course and should only be used when a
youth is a serious threat of safety or violence to self or others
and/or after all verbal de-escalation and behavior support
techniques have been exhausted.
• MDHHS Incident Report 151040198 dated 3/13/2023: The
incident report is consistent with Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4,
and Staff 5’s interviews. Youth A was yelling and raising
her hands to staff’s face. Staff 4 set limits for Youth A not
to put her hands in staff’s face. Youth A pushed Staff 2 and
raised her hand and extended her arm back as if she was
going to assault Staff 2. Staff 4 initiated the restraint due to
concern Youth A was going to assault Staff 2.
• MDHHS Incident Report 149120197 dated 2/9/2023: The
incident report is consistent with Staff 6 and Staff 7
interviews. The incident report indicates Youth A was
attempting to break the window at which time Staff 7 used
proximity control by placing himself between Youth A and
the window. Youth A began hitting and kicking Staff 7.
Staff 7 initiated a restraint. Staff 7 and Youth A slipped
while in the Benevolent restraint and Staff 7 transitioned
into the Aegis safety. Youth A was threatening to stab staff
with a pen.
• Spectrum Health After Visit Summary dated 3/13/2023:
Youth A was diagnosed with a right shoulder sprain-
unspecified shoulder sprain type, and bone lesion.
8

• Eagle Village Health Care Visit Report dated 2/10/2023:
Youth A was seen for bilateral shoulder pain after being
placed in a restraint. Youth A had good range of motion
and no discoloration of the skin.
• Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 6 personnel files: Staff 4, Staff 5,
and Staff 6 all received refresher Aegis Physical
Intervention training on 2/8/2023. Staff 4 does not have any
discipline in her personnel file. Staff 5 does not have any
discipline that relates to restraints. Staff 6 has one
discipline for an unwarranted restraint.
• Staff 7’s personnel file: Staff 7 received refresher Aegis
Physical Intervention Training on 10/20/2022. Staff 7 does
not have any discipline in his personnel file.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Interviews with Staff and Youth
indicate Youth A was not slammed to the ground during the
restraint as Staff 4 placed Youth A in an Aegis safety restraint
which is a seated restraint. Youth A indicated a shoulder injury
during the restraint, no reports of a mark below her left knee, nor
was there documentation or any staff reporting a knee injury/mark.
Youth A reported it was not the 3/13/2022 restraint where she was
slammed to the ground, it was a restraint a few weeks prior. Per
interviews with Staff 6 and Staff 7, Youth A was not slammed to
the ground, Staff 7 and Youth A slipped on ice during the restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132 Grievance Procedures
Section (2) The procedure shall provide for all of the following:
Description (b) Addressing matters that relate to compliance with the act,
rules promulgated under the act, and the agency’s written policies
and procedures regarding services covered by these rules.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth filed a grievance that was discarded by staff.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported she asked for a grievance after returning from nest.
Youth A did not recall who provided her the grievance, however,
she thought it was Staff 10. Youth A reported she filled out the
grievance and left it on the table in the house. Youth A reported
the next morning she saw the grievance sitting on the top of the
garbage can. Youth A reported she confronted Staff 10 about
throwing her grievance away and then went on with her day.
Youth A reported she did not take the grievance out of the
9

garbage as there was food on it. Youth A reported she did not fill
out another grievance.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A talked
to Staff 8 after returning from the hospital. Staff 8 offered Youth A
a grievance form. Staff 1 did not see Youth A fill out a grievance.
Youth A stated she was not completing a grievance while on nest
overnight and she would do one after returning from nest. Staff 1
did not know if Youth A completed a grievance as she does not
work in the house Youth A resides.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 were interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 and
Staff 4 did not have any knowledge of Youth A filling a grievance.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 5
reported Staff 8, Staff 9, and Staff 11 all gave Youth A a grievance
form however Youth A did not fill any of the grievances out.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 8 was the
on-call supervisor on duty on 3/13/2023. Staff 8 spoke with Youth
A. Youth A wanted a grievance form however Staff 8 did not have
a grievance form with him as the youth were on nest. Staff 8
informed Youth A that she could get a grievance form when she
returned to the Sherk House the next day. Youth A understood
that there were no grievance forms at nest. Staff 8 informed Staff
5 that Youth A would like a grievance form upon returning to the
Sherk House the next day. Staff 8 reported Youth A wanted to file
a grievance regarding the restraint however he did not know what
specifically. Staff 8 did not know if Youth A ever filled out a
grievance.
Staff 9 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 9
reported Youth A never asked her for a grievance form. If Youth A
had asked her for a grievance form, she would have given her
one. Staff 9 was working with another staff member, unsure
which staff, and there was a blank PR (privilege restriction)
packet. The blank PR packet was thrown away. Youth A followed
to see what was thrown away.
Staff 10 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/22/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 10
10

reported Youth A returned from nest on Tuesday. Staff 10 was off
Monday and Tuesday. Staff 10 reported the youth had been filling
out PR packets. Staff 9 threw the PR packet away and there may
have been a grievance form under it. Staff 10 denied ever giving
Youth A a grievance form. Staff 10 denied Youth A confronting
her about throwing the grievance away. Staff 10 did not know of
Youth A addressing any staff about throwing a grievance form
away.
Staff 11 was interviewed face-to-face via Teams on 3/30/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 11 worked with
Youth A when Youth A returned to the house from nest. Youth A
mentioned a grievance to Staff 11. Staff 11 offered Youth A a
grievance form and Youth A refused to take it. Staff 11 offered
Youth A another grievance form the following day and again Youth
A refused to take it. Staff 11 reported she had no knowledge of
Youth A ever completing a grievance form regarding the incident
or a completed grievance getting thrown away.
The complainant is the facilities assigned licensing
consultant as consultant was made aware during an interview
with the youth.
MDHHS worker did not have any findings in this
investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures for Grievance: Grievances will be submitted to
the Residential Treatment Supervisor of the house in which
the youth resides within 24 hours of the youth’s request. A
youth with an emergency grievance, such as lack of
essential medical care, may complain immediately to the
Family Therapist, Residential Treatment Supervisor, or
Director of Residential Services. If a youth has been the
victim of, or has witnessed, any form of sexual misconduct
or physical assault or neglect by a staff, the youth has the
right to request an immediate audience with any staff with
whom they feel comfortable to report the incident.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Interviews with staff indicate
Youth A was offered grievance forms however refused the
grievances and/or did not complete the grievance form.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
